title: Ticket #3934: transient collector statistics corruption?
description:
The following loop occasionally prints three lines after the header instead of one, and the first two of those lines are garbage -- but seemingly invariant garbage. (Search for undefined or 10534289 below.) This is probably a bug in the collector -- or maybe condor_status? 

root@condor# while true; do date; condor_status -collector -autof:h UpdatesLost_Start UpdatesTotal_Start 'real(UpdatesLost_Start)/UpdatesTotal_Start'  UpdatesLost_Submittor MonitorSelfRegisteredSocketCount; sleep 60; done
Thu Sep 19 13:16:42 EDT 2013
UpdatesLost_Start UpdatesTotal_Start real(UpdatesLost_Start)/UpdatesTotal_Start UpdatesLost_Submittor MonitorSelfRegisteredSocketCount
0                 126182             0.0                                        0                     652

remarks:
2013-Sep-19 14:08:49 by johnkn:
I don't see any way that the 'extra' collector would be a bug in condor_status, although it's more possible that the 'undefined' output might be.

do you expect to sometimes see more than one collector?

can you change the -autof argument list to include Name and MyAddress and see if you can capture a name or other identity for the 'undefined' collector?
creator: gthain
